sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The antidotharius in the whiche thou mayst learne howe thou shalte make many, and dyuers noble playsters, salues, oyntement, powders, bawmes, oyles, and wou[n]de drynkes, the whiche be very necessary, and behouefull, vtyle, and profytable, for euery surgyan, therin to be experte, and redy at all tymes of nede.
[40] p.
Imprynted by me Robert Wyer, dwellyng at the sygne of saynt Ioh[a]n Euangelyst, in saynt Martyns parysshe: besyde Charynge Crosse, [London : [1542?]]
Imprint from colophon; publication date suggested by STC. This edition distinguished from others by title page variant spelling: oyntement. Signatures: A-E⁴. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
The antidotharius in the whiche thou mayst learne howe thou shalte make many, and dyuers noble playsters, salues, oyntement, powders, bawmes, oyles, and wou[n]de drynkes, the whiche be very necessary, and behouefull, vtyle, and profytable, for euery surgyan, therin to be experte, and redy at all tymes of nede.
[40] p.
Imprynted by me Robert Wyer, dwellyng at the sygne of saynt Ioh[a]n Euangelyst, in saynt Martyns parysshe: besyde Charynge Crosse, [London : [1542?]]
Imprint from colophon; publication date suggested by STC. This edition distinguished from others by title page variant spelling: oyntement. Signatures: A-E⁴. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
